alert.note: Alert for Mason; Muskegon; Oceana (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 9:52PM EDT until September 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana and Muskegon counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM EDT Tuesday through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds over Lake Michigan will build waves late tonight and on Tuesday. Waves will likely reach the 3 to 5 foot range. North sides of north piers will be dangerous places to swim. Piers may become dangerous as well with waves out of the north crashing into them.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
